ingredients.item: 2 medium Waitrose British Blacktail Free Range Eggs
2 cooked and peeled beetroot, roughly sliced into quarters
1 eating apple, such as Braeburn, cored and sliced roughly into thin slices

instructions.step: Tip the breadcrumbs into a bowl and stir in the caraway seeds. Then sift the flour into a second bowl. Finally crack the eggs into a third bowl and beat them.

Unwrap the cheese and, taking one at a time, drop it into the flour, then into the eggs and finally into the breadcrumbs. Dip the cheese into the egg for a second dunk and then finish with a second coating of crumbs. Then repeat with the second cheese.

Pour about ½ cm depth of oil into a small frying pan over a medium-high heat. When hot, carefully lay the crumbed cheeses into the oil and cook for about 3 minutes each side, or until the crumbs are nicely browned and crisp. Tip the pan a little to help pool the oil and fry the sides of the cheese.
Remove the fried cheese and place on a piece of clean kitchen roll to drain any excess oil.

Quickly toss together the cut beetroot, apple, cider vinegar and rapeseed oil, and divide between 2 plates. Top each with a few pea shoots and chopped walnuts, then add the cheese and drizzle with the dressing.
